citations.narrative:
No records of disposition were available for two ducks that had left the facility within the past year. Failure to maintain
records of disposition prevents APHIS officials from accurately identifying the sources and destinations of animals. Per
this section, dealers and exhibitors shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose this
information. To be corrected by June 2, 2025.

The water receptacle was empty in an enclosure housing three chickens, and there was no evidence that it had spilled
just prior to the inspection, such as a pool or puddle. When offered access to water, the chickens drank for an extended
period of time, over 40 seconds cumulatively. This behavior suggests that the birds were dehydrated, which has the
potential to cause serious health problems and distress. The facility must ensure that potable water is provided in
sufficient quantity to every bird housed at the facility, as often as necessary to ensure their health and well-being.
Corrected at the time of inspection. To remain corrected after May 19, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
